title: Introduction to annif
text: annif service automated subject indexing based artificial intelligence based annif tool. Suggest subjects given text use following. get list projects use Suggest subjects batch (maximum 32 docs)
code: library(annif) suggestions <- annif_subject_indexing(project_id = "yso-en", text = "Jean Sibelius orchestra music and composer") print(suggestions) library(annif) projects <- get_annif_projects() print(projects) library(annif) texts <- c(   "A quick brown fox jumped over the lazy dog.",   "Climate change and global warming effects on Arctic ecosystems.",   "Machine learning applications in healthcare diagnostics."   ) results <- annif_batch_indexing( project_id = "yso-en", texts = texts, limit = 5 ) print(results)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Akewak Jeba. Author, maintainer. Leo Lahti. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jeba , Lahti L (2025). annif: Access 'annif' API. R package version 0.1.1, https://fennicahub.github.io/annif/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {annif: Access the 'annif' API},   author = {Akewak Jeba and Leo Lahti},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.1},   url = {https://fennicahub.github.io/annif/}, }

title: Access the annif API
text: annif package provides tools access serivice open source tool automated subject indexing.

title: Access the annif API
text: devel version annif can installed GitHub follows:
code: # Install annif if not already installed if (!requireNamespace("annif", quietly = TRUE)) {   remotes::install_github("fennicahub/annif") } remotes::install_github("fennicahub/annif")

title: Access the annif API
text: basic functionality ‘annif’ can explored follows:
code: # Load the package library(annif) # Perform a simple search and print a table  project_info <- get_annif_project_info(project_id = "yso-fi") print(project_info)

title: Access the annif API
text: Contributions welcome: Use issue tracker feedback bug reports. Send pull requests Star us Github page

title: Access the annif API
text: package way officially related endorsed annif. using metadata retrieved annif database work, please indicate metadata source annif. re-use involves kind modification data text, please state clearly end user. See annif policy copyright free re-use data detailed information certain exceptions.

what: Suggest subjects for a batch of documents via Annif REST API — annif_batch_indexing
title: Suggest subjects for a batch of documents via Annif REST API — annif_batch_indexing
text: function processes 32 documents single batch request Annif API automatic subject indexing.

title: Suggest subjects for a batch of documents via Annif REST API — annif_batch_indexing
code: annif_batch_indexing(   project_id,   texts,   doc_ids = NULL,   limit = 10,   threshold = 0,   language = NULL,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Suggest subjects for a batch of documents via Annif REST API — annif_batch_indexing
text: project_id Character string representing project identifier texts Character vector document texts analyze (maximum 32 documents) doc_ids Optional character vector document IDs limit Integer specifying maximum number results per document (default: 10) threshold Numeric value 0 1 minimum score (default: 0) language Character string language subject labels (default: NULL) verbose Logical indicating whether print debug information (default: FALSE)

title: Suggest subjects for a batch of documents via Annif REST API — annif_batch_indexing
text: tibble containing suggested subjects documents

what: Detect the language of a text using Annif API — annif_detect_language
title: Detect the language of a text using Annif API — annif_detect_language
text: function uses Annif API detect language given text supported languages: English ("en"), Finnish ("fi"), Sami ("se"), Swedish ("sv").

title: Detect the language of a text using Annif API — annif_detect_language
Detect the language of a text using Annif API — annif_detect_language
text: text Character string containing text analyze languages Character vector candidate language codes. Must subset : c("en", "fi", "se", "sv"). NULL, supported languages used.

title: Detect the language of a text using Annif API — annif_detect_language
text: tibble containing language detection results

title: Detect the language of a text using Annif API — annif_detect_language
code: # \donttest{ # Detect language with all supported languages result <- annif_detect_language(   text = "A quick brown fox jumped over the lazy dog." ) print(result) #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   language score #>   <chr>    <dbl> #> 1 en        1    #> 2 sv        0.25 #> 3 fi        0    #> 4 se        0     # Detect with specific subset of languages result <- annif_detect_language(   text = "Tämä on suomenkielinen teksti." ) print(result) #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   language score #>   <chr>    <dbl> #> 1 fi           1 #> 2 en           0 #> 3 se           0 #> 4 sv           0  # Get the top detected language if (!is.null(result)) {   top_language <- result[which.max(result$score), ]   cat("Detected language:", top_language$language,       "(confidence:", round(top_language$score, 3), ")\n") } #> Detected language: fi (confidence: 1 ) # }

what: Learn from manually indexed documents — annif_learn
title: Learn from manually indexed documents — annif_learn
text: function sends feedback Annif API improve project models learning manually assigned subjects. helps system improve suggestions time based human feedback.

title: Learn from manually indexed documents — annif_learn
Learn from manually indexed documents — annif_learn
text: project_id Character string representing project identifier (e.g., "yso-en", "yso-fi"). documents list documents correct subjects. verbose Logical indicating whether print debug information (default: FALSE)

title: Learn from manually indexed documents — annif_learn
text: Invisibly returns TRUE successful, FALSE otherwise. function primarily produces side effects (model learning) rather returning data.

title: Learn from manually indexed documents — annif_learn
code: # \donttest{ # Create a document with correct subjects for learning learning_doc <- list(   text = "A quick brown fox jumped over the lazy dog.",   subjects = list(     list(       uri = "http://www.yso.fi/onto/yso/p2228",       label = "red fox"     ),     list(       uri = "http://www.yso.fi/onto/yso/p5319",       label = "dog"     )   ),   metadata = list(     source = "example",     language = "en"   ) )  # Send learning feedback to the model success <- annif_learn(   project_id = "yso-en",   documents = list(learning_doc) ) #> Warning: Learning failed: Operation not allowed: Learning may be disabled for this project or requires authentication  if (success) {   cat("Learning feedback successfully submitted\n") } else {   cat("Failed to submit learning feedback\n") } #> Failed to submit learning feedback # }

what: Suggest subjects for a given text using the Annif REST API — annif_subject_indexing
title: Suggest subjects for a given text using the Annif REST API — annif_subject_indexing
text: function sends text Annif API automatic subject indexing returns suggested subjects labels, URIs, scores, notations.

title: Suggest subjects for a given text using the Annif REST API — annif_subject_indexing
code: annif_subject_indexing(   project_id,   text,   limit = 10,   threshold = 0,   language = NULL )

title: Suggest subjects for a given text using the Annif REST API — annif_subject_indexing
text: project_id Character string representing project identifier (e.g., "yso-en", "yso-fi", "hogwarts"). text Character string containing input text subjects suggested. limit Integer specifying maximum number results return. Default 10. threshold Numeric value 0 1 specifying minimum score threshold results. Default 0 (return results). language Character string specifying language subject labels. Default NULL (uses project default).

title: Suggest subjects for a given text using the Annif REST API — annif_subject_indexing
text: tibble containing suggested subjects following columns:

title: Suggest subjects for a given text using the Annif REST API — annif_subject_indexing
code: suggestions <- annif_subject_indexing(   project_id = "yso-en",   text = "Jean Sibelius orchestra music and composer" ) print(suggestions) #> # A tibble: 10 × 4 #>    label                uri                                score notation #>    <chr>                <chr>                              <dbl> <lgl>    #>  1 composers            http://www.yso.fi/onto/yso/p2353  0.705  NA       #>  2 biographical history http://www.yso.fi/onto/yso/p2718  0.523  NA       #>  3 art music            http://www.yso.fi/onto/yso/p18434 0.329  NA       #>  4 music                http://www.yso.fi/onto/yso/p1808  0.275  NA       #>  5 composing            http://www.yso.fi/onto/yso/p13332 0.239  NA       #>  6 orchestras           http://www.yso.fi/onto/yso/p5070  0.200  NA       #>  7 history of music     http://www.yso.fi/onto/yso/p14569 0.154  NA       #>  8 biographies          http://www.yso.fi/onto/yso/p11597 0.146  NA       #>  9 compositions (music) http://www.yso.fi/onto/yso/p1515  0.104  NA       #> 10 jeans                http://www.yso.fi/onto/yso/p19836 0.0811 NA

what: Get basic information about the Annif REST API — get_annif_api_info
title: Get basic information about the Annif REST API — get_annif_api_info
text: function retrieves basic information title version Annif API service. connects Annif REST API endpoint returns metadata API service.

title: Get basic information about the Annif REST API — get_annif_api_info
Get basic information about the Annif REST API — get_annif_api_info
code: # Get API information api_info <- get_annif_api_info() print(api_info) #> $title #> [1] "Annif REST API" #>  #> $version #> [1] "1.4.1" #>

what: Get detailed information about a specific project with expanded structure — get_annif_project_id
title: Get detailed information about a specific project with expanded structure — get_annif_project_id
text: function retrieves comprehensive information specified project returns tibble expanded nested structures, showing individual components nested objects.

title: Get detailed information about a specific project with expanded structure — get_annif_project_id
Get detailed information about a specific project with expanded structure — get_annif_project_id
text: project_id character string representing project identifier (e.g., "yso-fi", "yso-en", "hogwarts").

title: Get detailed information about a specific project with expanded structure — get_annif_project_id
text: tibble multiple rows showing expanded project information, nested structures broken individual rows: backend - Backend information named list is_trained - Whether project trained language - Project language modification_time - Last modification timestamp name - Human-readable name project project_id - Unique identifier project vocab - Vocabulary information named list vocab_language - Vocabulary language used project

title: Get detailed information about a specific project with expanded structure — get_annif_project_id
code: # \donttest{ # Get expanded project information project_info <- get_annif_project_id("yso-fi") print(project_info) #> # A tibble: 4 × 8 #>   backend      is_trained language modification_time   name     project_id vocab #>   <named list> <lgl>      <chr>    <dttm>              <chr>    <chr>      <nam> #> 1 <chr [1]>    TRUE       fi       2025-09-16 16:34:33 YSO NN … yso-fi     <chr> #> 2 <chr [1]>    TRUE       fi       2025-09-16 16:34:33 YSO NN … yso-fi     <lgl> #> 3 <chr [1]>    TRUE       fi       2025-09-16 16:34:33 YSO NN … yso-fi     <int> #> 4 <chr [1]>    TRUE       fi       2025-09-16 16:34:33 YSO NN … yso-fi     <chr> #> # ℹ 1 more variable: vocab_language <chr> # }

what: Get a list of available projects — get_annif_projects
title: Get a list of available projects — get_annif_projects
text: function retrieves information available projects Annif service, including configuration, training status, associated vocabulary information.

title: Get a list of available projects — get_annif_projects
Get a list of available projects — get_annif_projects
text: data frame (tibble) containing information available

title: Get a list of available projects — get_annif_projects
code: # \donttest{ # Get all available projects projects <- get_annif_projects() print(projects) #> # A tibble: 13 × 11 #>    project_id      name  language backend_id vocab_id vocab_languages vocab_size #>    <chr>           <chr> <chr>    <chr>      <chr>    <list>               <int> #>  1 yso-fi          YSO … fi       nn_ensemb… yso      <chr [4]>            39365 #>  2 yso-sv          YSO … sv       nn_ensemb… yso      <chr [4]>            39365 #>  3 yso-en          YSO … en       nn_ensemb… yso      <chr [4]>            39365 #>  4 yso-mllm-fi     YSO … fi       mllm       yso      <chr [4]>            39365 #>  5 yso-mllm-en     YSO … en       mllm       yso      <chr [4]>            39365 #>  6 yso-mllm-sv     YSO … sv       mllm       yso      <chr [4]>            39365 #>  7 yso-bonsai-fi   YSO … fi       omikuji    yso      <chr [4]>            39365 #>  8 yso-bonsai-sv   YSO … sv       omikuji    yso      <chr [4]>            39365 #>  9 yso-bonsai-en   YSO … en       omikuji    yso      <chr [4]>            39365 #> 10 yso-fasttext-fi YSO … fi       fasttext   yso      <chr [4]>            39365 #> 11 yso-fasttext-sv YSO … sv       fasttext   yso      <chr [4]>            39365 #> 12 yso-fasttext-en YSO … en       fasttext   yso      <chr [4]>            39365 #> 13 hogwarts        Hogw… en       fasttext   hogwarts <chr [1]>                4 #> # ℹ 4 more variables: vocab_loaded <lgl>, vocab_language <chr>, #> #   is_trained <lgl>, modification_time <dttm> # }

what: Get a list of available vocabularies — get_annif_vocabulary_info
title: Get a list of available vocabularies — get_annif_vocabulary_info
text: function retrieves information available vocabularies Annif service, including IDs, languages, sizes, loading status.

title: Get a list of available vocabularies — get_annif_vocabulary_info
Get a list of available vocabularies — get_annif_vocabulary_info
text: data frame (tibble) containing information available

title: Get a list of available vocabularies — get_annif_vocabulary_info
code: # \donttest{ # Get all available vocabularies vocabs <- get_annif_vocabulary_info() print(vocabs) #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   vocab_id languages  size loaded #>   <chr>    <list>    <int> <lgl>  #> 1 yso      <chr [4]> 39365 TRUE   #> 2 hogwarts <chr [1]>     4 TRUE   # }
